<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 209]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 304, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 5 Mechanics 2 (M2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 260, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 352, 828, 368]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 495, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 285, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 720, 510]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 590, 526]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 527, 606, 543]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 558, 606, 573]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 574, 756, 590]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 590, 440, 606]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 606, 907, 637]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A small sphere of mass \(0.4 \mathrm{kg}\) moves with constant speed \(1.5 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) in a horizontal circle inside a smooth fixed hollow cylinder of diameter \(0.6 \mathrm{m}\). The axis of the cylinder is vertical, and the sphere is in contact with both the horizontal base and the vertical curved surface of the cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 135, 154, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
Calculate the magnitude of the force exerted on the sphere by the vertical curved surface of the cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 183, 151, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 183, 905, 201]]<|/det|>
Hence show that the magnitude of the total force exerted on the sphere by the cylinder is \(5 \mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 920, 216]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 245, 96, 263]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 245, 920, 278]]<|/det|>
A uniform semicircular lamina of radius \(0.25 \mathrm{m}\) has diameter \(AB\). It is freely suspended at \(A\) from a fixed point and hangs in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 291, 153, 308]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 291, 761, 308]]<|/det|>
Find the distance of the centre of mass of the lamina from the diameter \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 291, 920, 308]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 322, 151, 339]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 322, 695, 339]]<|/det|>
Calculate the angle which the diameter \(AB\) makes with the vertical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 322, 920, 339]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 352, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
The lamina is now held in equilibrium with the diameter \(AB\) vertical by means of a force applied at \(B\). This force has magnitude \(6 \mathrm{N}\) and acts at \(45^{\circ}\) to the upward vertical in the plane of the lamina.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 400, 153, 417]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 400, 440, 417]]<|/det|>
Calculate the weight of the lamina.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 400, 920, 418]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 445, 92, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 445, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.2 \mathrm{kg}\) is attached to one end of a light elastic string of natural length \(1.6 \mathrm{m}\) and modulus of elasticity \(18 \mathrm{N}\). The other end of the string is attached to a fixed point \(O\) which is \(1.6 \mathrm{m}\) above a smooth horizontal surface. \(P\) is placed on the surface vertically below \(O\) and then projected horizontally. \(P\) moves with initial speed \(1.5 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) in a straight line on the surface. Show that, when \(OP = 1.8 \mathrm{m}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 534, 156, 552]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 534, 364, 551]]<|/det|>
\(P\) is at instantaneous rest,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 534, 920, 551]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 559, 153, 577]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 559, 567, 577]]<|/det|>
\(P\) is on the point of losing contact with the surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 559, 920, 577]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 604, 96, 623]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 604, 920, 637]]<|/det|>
A ball \(B\) is projected from a point \(O\) on horizontal ground at an angle of \(40^{\circ}\) above the horizontal. \(B\) hits the ground \(1.8 \mathrm{s}\) after the instant of projection. Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 645, 153, 663]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 645, 386, 663]]<|/det|>
the speed of projection of \(B\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 645, 920, 663]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 670, 153, 688]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 670, 351, 688]]<|/det|>
the greatest height of \(B\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 670, 920, 688]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 694, 153, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 694, 636, 712]]<|/det|>
the distance from \(O\) of the point at which \(B\) hits the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 694, 920, 712]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 84, 650, 203]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 223, 920, 323]]<|/det|>
A block \(B\) of mass \(3\mathrm{kg}\) is attached to one end of a light elastic string of modulus of elasticity \(70\mathrm{N}\) and natural length \(1.4\mathrm{m}\). The other end of the string is attached to a particle \(P\) of mass \(0.3\mathrm{kg}\). \(B\) is at rest \(0.9\mathrm{m}\) from the edge of a horizontal table and the string passes over a small smooth pulley at the edge of the table. \(P\) is released from rest at a point next to the pulley and falls vertically. At the first instant when \(P\) is \(0.8\mathrm{m}\) below the pulley and descending, \(B\) is in limiting equilibrium with the part of the string attached to \(B\) horizontal (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 333, 156, 352]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 333, 667, 352]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed of \(P\) when \(B\) is first in limiting equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 335, 920, 352]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 364, 153, 382]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 364, 601, 382]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficient of friction between \(B\) and the table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 920, 383]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 411, 96, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 420, 761, 523]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 542, 920, 606]]<|/det|>
A uniform solid cone of height \(0.6\mathrm{m}\) and mass \(0.5\mathrm{kg}\) has its axis of symmetry vertical and its vertex \(V\) uppermost. The semi-vertical angle of the cone is \(60^{\circ}\) and the surface is smooth. The cone is fixed to a horizontal surface. A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.2\mathrm{kg}\) is connected to \(V\) by a light inextensible string of length \(0.4\mathrm{m}\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 619, 156, 637]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 619, 920, 653]]<|/det|>
Calculate the height, above the horizontal surface, of the centre of mass of the cone with the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 636, 920, 655]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 667, 920, 686]]<|/det|>
\(P\) is set in motion, and moves with angular speed \(4 \mathrm{rad} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) in a circular path on the surface of the cone.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 698, 153, 715]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 698, 920, 732]]<|/det|>
Show that the tension in the string is \(1.96 \mathrm{N}\), and calculate the magnitude of the force exerted on \(P\) by the cone.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 714, 920, 732]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 744, 153, 761]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 744, 322, 761]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 744, 920, 761]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 791, 94, 810]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 790, 920, 841]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.5\mathrm{kg}\) moves in a straight line on a smooth horizontal surface. The velocity of \(P\) is \(\nu \mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) when the displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) is \(x\mathrm{m}\). A single horizontal force of magnitude \(0.16\mathrm{e}^{x}\mathrm{N}\) acts on \(P\) in the direction \(OP\). The velocity of \(P\) when it is at \(O\) is \(0.8\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 858, 153, 876]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 856, 331, 876]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\nu = 0.8\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 860, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 890, 153, 907]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 889, 544, 907]]<|/det|>
Find the time taken by \(P\) to travel \(1.4 \mathrm{m}\) from \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 891, 920, 908]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
